text: yes you could fry your Piratas inside on
your stove but you could also throw them
on your grill now which is more fun
parathas require a lot of butter so I've
got some here and I'm just gonna keep it
warm right on my grill whenever I make
parathas I like to use a little bit of
whole wheat flour in the dough just
gives them the sort of nutty flavor
which I like and in fact you could roll
these out the day before and then just
bring them down when you're ready to
grill this dough is extremely easy to
work with
just roll it into a six inch circle and
now here's my twist most poor atados
just get melted butter I'm also adding
sliced dates dates give it this is
jammie sweetness so it's Parata plus so
you want to put the dates just on half
of the Parata dough and then fold the
other half over more melted butter
because Parata is I'd say 50% butter 50%
other stuff fold it in half again and
then just roll it out just a little bit
before you grill them you just have to
oil them up a little bit so they don't
stick and then you can plop them right
on the grill you want to keep an eye on
them as they cook your grill is gonna
have hot spots it's gonna have cooler
spots so feel free to move them around
and what you're looking for is you want
distinct grill marks and a golden brown
color before you flip them on to the
other side there's a fine line between
you know burnished and ever so slightly
burnt but we are not going for Parata
perfection we're just going for Parata
deliciousness parathas are usually
served in the context of a meal but
they're also great served with a little
dip all by themselves so for this recipe
I've done a little riff on a writer and
then I put walnuts on top
more mint leaves because they're pretty
I had some dried rose petals so I
crushed those and put them on top could
also use sumac or pomegranate seeds or
even just a little bit of sweet paprika
will do it this is definitely something
that you can make is a nosh before your
steak or with your chicken or whatever
but you know what it's actually
something that you can make all by
itself because it's that good you need
no media excuse
